citations.narrative:
One rabbit (predominantly white with black markings) had a nest box that was left in the enclosure. The box had a
buildup of hair and fecal material in it. This animal was not in need the nest box according to the licensee. This nest box
needs to be removed and cleaned for the health and well-being of the animal. (a)(1) Primary enclosures shall be kept
reasonably free of excreta, hair, cobwebs and other debris by periodic cleaning.
Correct by: 09-18-2021

The water receptacles were in need of cleaning and fresh water added. Tanks had a buildup of green algae and dirt in
them. Clean water is necessary for the health and comfort of the animals. All water receptacles shall be kept clean and
sanitary.
Correct by: 09-17-2021

Throughout the animal enclosures and paddocks there were pieces of trash such as plastic and baling twine. Premises
(buildings and grounds) shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the animals from injury and to facilitate
the prescribed husbandry practice. The trash needs to be picked up and properly disposed of to protect the animals from
possibly getting entangled in it or ingesting it.
Correct by: 09-18-2021
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Owner.
End Section

narrative:
3.56(a) 
   
Sanitation. 
One rabbit (predominantly white with black markings) had a nest box that was left in the enclosure.   The box had a 
buildup of hair and fecal material in it.  This animal was not in need the nest box according to the licensee.  This nest box 
needs to be removed and cleaned for the health and well-being of the animal.  (a)(1) Primary enclosures shall be kept 
reasonably free of excreta, hair, cobwebs and other debris by periodic cleaning. 
 
Correct by:  09-18-2021 
3.130 
   
Watering. 
The water receptacles were in need of cleaning and fresh water added.  Tanks had a buildup of green algae and dirt in 
them.  Clean water is necessary for the health and comfort of the animals.  All water receptacles shall be kept clean and 
sanitary. 
 
Correct by:  09-17-2021 
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation.

Throughout the animal enclosures and paddocks there were pieces of trash such as plastic and baling twine.  Premises 
(buildings and grounds) shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the animals from injury and to facilitate 
the prescribed husbandry practice.  The trash needs to be picked up and properly disposed of to protect the animals from 
possibly getting entangled  in it or ingesting it. 
 
Correct by:  09-18-2021 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Owner. 
 
End Section
